page.title: 19TAKE_AWAY_FOOD
page.content: There are quite a lot of take-away food shops in the Keyham area. There are fish and chip shops, and Chinese and Indian 'take-aways'. Our mums and dads can remember when there were just fish and chip shops. At the Golden Boat, a chinese 'take-away', the food is prepared by two people. They are open every day of the week between 17.30 and 23.30. Most of the meals consist of chicken, prawns or beef, chinese vegetables such as beanshoots and rice or noodles. Some people prefer chips to rice. Popular dishes are curries, sweet and sour and chop suey. We did a survey and found that many people have a 'take-away' between once and four times a month. The Indian 'take-away' is used mostly by sailors, who are used to foreign food, and so a new branch has just been opened outside the dockyard gates.
